ignore.reason: The text in question is both in Italian and a song name, so italics are appropriate.

Unfortunately, none of the standard CSS selectors work well for this case. We want to target the second (and last) em tag of the whole chapter, but :nth-of-type and :last-of-type are relative to the parent of the em tag, which will be a p tag. Therefore, in order to target this tag without using a special class you would have to use a p:nth-of-type selector, which is unreadable and would involve counting the exact number of paragraphs. Using a custom class here also has some ancillary benefits since “underlined” has some semantic meaning appropriate to what is being described in the text.
